tldr: The author, Thomas Andrew Knight, observed that young animals, like spaniels and retrievers, can inherit instinctive propensities from their parents. He found that these instincts can change over generations, as seen in woodcocks' fear of humans. Knight also noticed that hybrid offspring may have a stronger influence from the male parent. This study suggests that hereditary instincts can be influenced by education and breeding.
